channel.title: Math help
channel.description: could some one explain to me about a "box-and-whisker plot" please?if i dont get this i fail the school year

item.title: Math help
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

you have a set of nubers,you put them in order from least to greatest.then you find the meadian of the problem,then find the lower quartile and the higher quartile and put on a number line with the appropriate scale.

ex.19,20,22,23,25,25,27,30,34,35,40.now find the median.the median is the 25 to the right of the other 25,now circle the 25 to the right of the other 25.now find the lower quartile,the lower quartile is the median of the numbers to the left of the circled 25,witch the lower quartile would be 22.now find the higher quartile by finding the median of the numbers to the right of the circled 25.now graph the on a number line(use a scale that would fit the numbers)
i made the scale go up by 5’s starting at 15.now find the median on the number line and put a line above it,then find the lower quartile on the number line and put a lne over it,then find the higher quartile and put a line over it,now make a box around the lower quartile,median,and the higher quartile,now draw wiskers from both ends of the box to the end of the number line and there you go.hope this helped.

Read full topic
